questions.question: What differentiates a pushdown automaton (PDA) from a finite automaton?
If a PDA ends with an empty stack, what does that indicate?

answers.a: The input string was not recognized
answers.c: The input string was recognized (in empty stack acceptance)
answers.d: The stack had a fixed size

questions.question: What primarily differentiates a context-free grammar from a regular grammar?

answers.c: The type of rules that can be included

questions.question: Why are pushdown automata suitable for recognizing context-free languages?

answers.b: Because they can store past states in the stack
answers.c: Because of their infinite memory capability
answers.d: Because they can keep track of nested structures using the stack
